ClinGen Disease: ADNP-related multiple congenital anomalies - intellectual disability - autism spectrum disorder
intellectual disability-severe speech delay-mild dysmorphism syndrome

Comment TH: missense-only gene; whole gene dup in 2-1374-003 and father

Comments MR: Neurofibromatosis 1 gene. Features of autism spectrum disorder occur in up to 30% of children with NF1 (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK1109/ ) . I am really surprised that this only came out as moderate by EAGLE?
NDD gene. Autistic behaviour in some patients (https://omim.org/clinicalSynopsis/615502)

Relatively recently described, convincing gene for NDD and autism, with statistical support (https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30879638/ , https://www.nature.com/articles/s41525-019-0093-8.pdf?origin=ppub ; also SPARK chohort? )
Has been linked to autism, but the link has so far been either weak.
NDD gene, stereotypic behaviour and autism can be a feature (https://omim.org/clinicalSynopsis/617330 , https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.08.28.270751v1 )

ClinGen Disease: severe intellectual disability-progressive spastic diplegia syndrome
developmental delay with variable intellectual impairment and behavioral abnormalities

Comments MR: NDD gene, ASD is a feature (https://omim.org/clinicalSynopsis/618009). Didn't this one come up in Ryan's paper?

Comment TH: in 11q13.2q13.4 deletion region (not many cases described)

Comments MR: NDD gene, ASD is a feature (https://omim.org/clinicalSynopsis/617787)
Comment TH: also comes up recently in CHD (PMIDs: 33557580, 33103328, 31127942)

Comments MR: NDD gene, but has mostly been associated with epilepsy. ASD is not known to be common.
Has been found in ASD subjects, but still a candidate, I think (https://pubmed-ncbi-nlm-nih-gov.myaccess.library.utoronto.ca/30504930/). I think it is an interesting gene to highlight.

Comment TH: in 1p36 terminal region (includes GABRD); variable breakpoints many smaller regions

Comments MR: Associated with hearing loss/aural atresia (only two LP/P variants in Clinvar), not known to be associated with ASD

NDD gene. About half of individuals with KCNB1 encephalopathy also have behavioral conditions, including attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and autism spectrum disorder (ASD). https://medlineplus.gov/genetics/condition/kcnb1-encephalopathy/
NDD gene, less commonly reported with ASD features (https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30055086/)
Candidate gene? https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4489950/, Didn't this one come up in Ryan's paper?
Congenital anomalies syndrome, can be associated with NDD (ID and autism) (https://academic.oup.com/hmg/article/26/24/4849/4210002)
Novel ASD candidate gene? CAMTA1 has been associated with NDD, including autism
NDD gene, associated with behavioural problems, mostly missense affecting the C2B calcium-binding domain.
NDD gene, associated with behavioural problems (not many patients described so far) https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5687290/
Candidate gene for ID and ASD (https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29770430/, https://www.nature.com/articles/s41436-020-0815-4)

Associated with hearing loss (https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00439-018-1965-1). De novo variants found in subjects with ASD (https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2211124717319113?via%3Dihub)
NDD gene, ASD is not so rare (https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31060130/)
Tuberous sclerosis, with high risk for ASD (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK1220/)
Novel ASD candidate gene? Biallelic LOF variants are associated with skeletal dysplasia (PMID: 33106379).
Novel ASD candidate gene? Associated with AD erythrocytosis.
NDD gene, has also been associated with behavioural problems (https://onlinelibrary-wiley-com.myaccess.library.utoronto.ca/doi/epdf/10.1002/humu.24001)
